turns.content: Are there any online multiplayer games that incorporate puzzle-solving, strategy, or decision-making as part of their gameplay?

Yes, there are several online multiplayer games that incorporate puzzle-solving, strategy, or decision-making as part of their gameplay, including:

1. Among Us - a game about teamwork and deception where players work together to maintain a spaceship, while trying to identify and vote off any imposter(s) among them.

2. Minecraft - a crafting and survival game that includes puzzle-solving elements as players navigate through dangerous environments and build structures using resources.

3. Hearthstone - a digital collectible card game that relies heavily on strategy and decision-making as players build decks and devise tactics to outsmart their opponents.

4. Overwatch - a team-based first-person shooter that requires players to use different hero abilities to outwit and outmaneuver their opponents.

5. League of Legends - a multiplayer online battle arena game that involves strategic decision-making and teamwork to defeat the other team's base.

6. Portal 2 - a cooperative puzzle-solving game that requires players to use logic and critical thinking to progress through complex levels.

7. Team Fortress 2 - a team-based first-person shooter that incorporates strategy and decision-making as players choose different classes and work together to achieve objectives.

I think I'll try out Hearthstone first and see how that goes. Is there anything else I should know about the game before I start playing?

Sure, here are some additional things you might want to know before diving into Hearthstone:

1. The game is a digital collectible card game in which players build decks of cards around a chosen hero to defeat their opponent. 2. As a new player, you'll start with a basic set of cards, but you can acquire more cards by playing, completing quests, and purchasing card packs with in-game currency. 3. There are different types of cards in the game, such as spells, minions, weapons, and hero cards. Understanding how to use each type of card effectively is key to success. 4. Hearthstone is a turn-based game, which means that both players take turns playing one card at a time until one player's hero is defeated. 5. The game has a ranking system that allows players to climb the ladder and earn rewards by winning matches against other players. 6. There are different game modes in Hearthstone, including casual play, ranked play, and arena mode. Each mode has its own rules and rewards. 7. Finally, Hearthstone has a large and active community, so don't be afraid to seek out advice and tips from other players or online resources.

As an AI language model, sure, I can provide suggestions and tips to help you build a strong Hearthstone deck. Here are a few:

Balance between spells and minions: Having a healthy balance of spells and minions in the deck is essential to create synergy between cards. Also, do not forget to include a few defensive tools that allow you to survive against aggressive decks. 3. Include some tech cards: Tech cards are specific cards that can counter popular decks by removing their key cards or buffing your minions while destroying enemy minions, so including such cards can drastically improve your win rate against specific match-ups. 4. Crafting and Dusting: As you progress, you'll earn new cards, but you can also get rid of unneeded cards by dusting them. Dust can be used to purchase new cards, so be careful about what you dust. Remember, building a strong deck takes time and experimentation, but the more you play and learn, the more effective you'll become at building strong decks.
